sorular.soru: What is the risk when overtaking an agricultural vehicle on a narrow road?
cevaplar: You risk entering the soft verge.
sorular.dogruCevap: You risk entering the soft verge.

feedback.metin: Because the road is very narrow, there is a risk you may enter the soft, unsafe verge while overtaking. This may lead to loss of control of the steering wheel. If you want to overtake, you must be sure that you can do so without causing danger or hindrance. When your position is correct before overtaking, that means having enough distance and driving slightly to the left, your view on oncoming traffic will suffice and your own visibility will be good enough.

sorular.soru: In one spot on the tyre, the wear indicators start to wear along with the tread. Is driving allowed with that tyre?

feedback.metin: The tyre should have at least 1.6 mm of tread depth over the entire tread. As soon as the wear indicators start to wear with the tread, the tread depth is less than 1.6 mm at that spot. In that case you are not allowed to drive with that tyre, even if the rest of the tread still has sufficient tread depth.

sorular.soru: You have to stop for a red traffic light. How do you do this as environmentally friendly as possible?
cevaplar: Let the vehicle roll out in gear.
Shift down as soon as possible.
sorular.dogruCevap: Let the vehicle roll out in gear.

feedback.metin: If you need to slow down, the most environmentally friendly way to do so is to let the car roll out in gear for as long as possible. When doing so, do not press the clutch pedal too early. This way, the car brakes gently on the engine. The less you have to brake, the more energy-efficient. It also allows you to anticipate more fluently when the traffic light changes to green. Shifting down to a lower gear early causes higher revs. This is bad for the engine and the environment.

sorular.soru: Which insurance is mandatory when you own a passenger car?
cevaplar: Car insurance with limited hull coverage.
Car insurance with comprehensive hull coverage.

feedback.metin: Car insurance consists of liability and comprehensive coverage, with liability coverage being mandatory. Liability insurance covers any damage you cause to other vehicles but does not cover damage caused to your own vehicle. This insurance is usually known as third-party liability insurance. Hull insurance covers damage to other vehicles and damage to your own vehicle. Limited hull insurance only covers damage to your vehicle when said damage is caused by fire, theft, a storm, or a collision with a wild animal. Comprehensive hull insurance usually covers all damage to your car. The latter is also known as all-risk insurance.

sorular.soru: You want to ride on a motorcycle with sidecar. What driving licence do you need?

feedback.metin: For a motorcycle with sidecar, you need the same driving licence as for a normal motorcycle. This is driving licence A. Driving licence B allows you to drive a passenger car and driving licence AM allows you to ride a moped.

sorular.soru: You cannot merge yet. Are you allowed to signal left at this point?
cevaplar: Yes. So other road users can make room for you.
No. Indicating before merging is not required.

feedback.metin: Try to observe traffic on the carriageway as early as possible to determine whether you have an opportunity to merge. Only indicate immediately before you actually merge. Merging is a special manoeuvre whereby you are required to give way to all traffic on the carriageway and merge safely without forcing space between traffic.

sorular.soru: What should you take into consideration here?
cevaplar: That the cyclist may swerve suddenly.
That you may have issues with aquaplaning.
That the pedestrian may cross unexpectedly.
sorular.dogruCevap: That the cyclist may swerve suddenly.

feedback.metin: You are about to pass a cyclist. However, he is approaching a puddle on the cycle lane. Chances are that he will want to ride around it and will enter your lane for this. Keep this in mind by staying behind the cyclist until they have passed the puddle.

sorular.soru: During driving this light starts flashing. What should you do?
cevaplar: Drive on to the garage and have it checked.
Stop immediately and call the breakdown service.
Drive on and tell your garage at the next service appointment.
sorular.dogruCevap: Stop immediately and call the breakdown service.

feedback.metin: This light indicates a problem with the engine management. If this light comes on (but does not blink), you can still drive on to the garage and have the car checked. But as soon as the light starts flashing, you should stop and call the breakdown service. This could mean an acute problem with the engine; driving on could cause additional damage.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake here?

feedback.metin: Overtaking in foggy weather is not safe because of limited visibility. If overtaking is not safe, it is not allowed.

sorular.soru: When should you indicate right here?
cevaplar: As soon as you enter the roundabout.
Just before you exit the roundabout.

feedback.metin: If you are approaching a roundabout and intend to turn right, indicate right well in advance of joining the roundabout. This gives other drivers the chance to anticipate your actions. Drivers coming from the first exit, in particular, will benefit from this.

sorular.soru: In this situation, can you use the hard shoulder to get in front of the lorry?

feedback.metin: Using the hard shoulder when merging is prohibited. The acceleration lanes are long enough to control speed and to be able to merge safely via this lane. Under no circumstances should you use the hard shoulder to pass another vehicle. In this case, merge behind the lorry. If you must brake for this, you were either not paying attention before, or you have misjudged the situation.

sorular.soru: The maximum authorised mass of the passenger car is 1550 kg and the maximum authorised mass of the trailer is 950 kg. What driving licence do you at least need to drive this combination?

feedback.metin: The maximum authorised mass of the trailer is more than 750 kg. However, the maximum authorised mass of the combination does not exceed 3500 kg, so a B driving licence is sufficient.

sorular.soru: How many adult passengers are allowed to sit here?

feedback.metin: This rear seat is equipped with three seat belts. This means that three passengers are allowed to sit here.

sorular.soru: Who should move onto the verge?

feedback.metin: When two vehicles are approaching each other, either may swerve. However, swerving into the verge is very dangerous for lorries and buses due to their weight. They are more likely to sink into the verge. The driver of the passenger car must swerve as much as possible.

sorular.soru: Can you stop here to drop off a passenger?

feedback.metin: Normally, stopping at a bus stop with a passenger car is only allowed to drop off or pick up passengers immediately. However, stopping on or directly next to a bus lane is prohibited. So if the bus stop is on a bus lane, you may not stop to let passengers get on or off.

sorular.soru: What happens during the thinking time?
cevaplar: You drive on at the same speed.
sorular.dogruCevap: You drive on at the same speed.

feedback.metin: Thinking time, or reaction time, is the time that elapses between perceiving and acting. That is, from the moment you see that you have to do something until you actually do it. So during the thinking time, you do not react yet, and drive on at the same speed. The thinking time for a healthy alert driver is on average one second.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the oncoming passenger car?

feedback.metin: The F-5 sign indicates a ban on continuing to drive when approaching traffic coming from the opposite direction. If no oncoming traffic is approaching, you can drive on carefully. On the other side of the road, the F-6 sign will advise traffic on that side that they have right of way.

sorular.soru: Are trams subject to the same traffic rules as public buses?

feedback.metin: Public buses fall into the category of motor vehicles. Vehicles such as trams and metros that travel on rails do not fall into the motor vehicle category. Keep in mind that these vehicles operate on a fixed position from which they cannot deviate, which is why they are subject to different rules.

sorular.soru: Do passenger cars have to be equipped with red retro-reflectors at the rear?

feedback.metin: Passenger cars must be fitted with two red retro-reflectors at the rear. These may be incorporated in the rear lights.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the moped rider?

feedback.metin: Sign D-104 indicates where moped riders must enter the carriageway, both inside and outside built-up areas. They must pass this sign on the left. As this is seen as merging, the moped rider has to let other drivers pass in front of him when doing so. So you do not have to wait for the moped driver. However, as many motorists fail to notice these signs, they do not expect a moped rider and may be startled by this.

sorular.soru: How fast are you allowed to drive here on the A4?

feedback.metin: Electronic signs or matrix signs indicate a speed limit for that particular lane. Sometimes different speeds may apply to different lanes, for example because traffic on the exit lane is approaching with less traffic nuisance than on the main carriageway, or vice versa. On the lane where you are driving, on the A4, a speed limit of 70 km/h applies.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to enter this road?

feedback.metin: The G-9 sign indicates that this is a bridle path. You are not allowed to drive here in a passenger car.

sorular.soru: What does a yellow flashing pedestrian light mean?

feedback.metin: Some pedestrian lights have a green light and a red light, while others have a green light and a yellow light. A green light means pedestrians can cross the road. A green flashing light means pedestrians can cross the road and the red light will appear shortly. A red light means pedestrians cannot start to cross the road, and pedestrians already crossing must proceed as quickly as possible to clear the pedestrian crossing. At some pedestrian lights, the red light is replaced by a yellow flashing triangular light. Pedestrians can cross here, but at their own risk. This means they are not covered by the same legal protection that a green pedestrian light guarantees.

sorular.soru: Which number plate should a trailer with a maximum authorised mass of 700 kg have?
cevaplar: A yellow number plate with its own registration number.
A white number plate with its own registration number.
A white number plate matching the number plate of the vehicle.
sorular.dogruCevap: A white number plate matching the number plate of the vehicle.

feedback.metin: Trailers with a maximum authorised mass of up to 750 kg do not have their own registration number. These trailers must have a white number plate with the same registration number as that of the towing vehicle. Trailers with a maximum authorised mass of more than 750 kg must have a yellow number plate with their own registration number.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the cyclist?

feedback.metin: If you want to exit the roundabout, you must give way to all traffic continuing around the roundabout.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake the motorcycle here?

feedback.metin: The F-3 sign indicates that lorry drivers overtaking motor vehicles is prohibited. A lorry is not allowed to overtake a motorcyclist here, but you are.

sorular.soru: Are you pre-sorted correctly to turn left?

feedback.metin: This is a complete one-way street. This means that no driver from the other side is allowed to drive into the one-way street. If you want to turn left, you have to pre-sort at the left-hand side of the road as much as possible.

sorular.soru: Which vehicle is not a motor carriage?

feedback.metin: Motor carriages are all vehicles that are propelled by means of a motor. It may not be moved along rails (such as a train, metro or tram). Bicycles with pedal assistance are also not motor carriages. Note: Trolley buses and speed pedelecs are classed as motor carriages!

sorular.soru: Who should go first?
cevaplar: They give way to each other.

feedback.metin: When weaving, traffic merging in and out may enter the same lane simultaneously. As you must give way to other traffic when merging, there is no law regarding who can do this first. However, national recommendations say that the driver merging out should go first, as they are often driving faster. This is also less of an inconvenience to drivers on the main carriageway.

sorular.soru: What does this light on the dashboard indicate?
cevaplar: There is a malfunction with the airbag.
The seat belt is not being used.
The power steering does not work.
sorular.dogruCevap: There is a malfunction with the airbag.

feedback.metin: This warning light indicates an airbag malfunction.

sorular.soru: Are you still allowed to change lanes and drive straight on?

feedback.metin: You are not allowed to change lanes at the level of the solid line and you are obliged to follow the direction indicated by the arrow on the pre-sorting lane.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive at 100 km/h here?

feedback.metin: Speed limits apply under optimal conditions. When conditions deteriorate, for example, due to bad weather or a poor road surface, you must adapt your speed to the circumstances.

sorular.soru: What kind of lighting should you use here?

feedback.metin: You must use dipped headlights when driving through a tunnel. Dipped headlights must be switched on well before entering a tunnel.

sorular.soru: Are there stricter rules for a newly qualified driver's licence?

feedback.metin: Stricter conditions apply to new drivers. Someone who is guilty of dangerous driving behaviour may receive penalty points. If you receive your second penalty point, the CBR will investigate whether you are sufficiently capable of driving. If this is not the case, your driving licence will be declared invalid and you will have to obtain your driving licence again.

sorular.soru: Are you well-positioned in case of a breakdown?

feedback.metin: In the event of an emergency, you can use the hard shoulder or refuge. Turn on your hazard lights and use the warning triangle as an additional safety measure. Always park your vehicle as far to the right as possible on the hard shoulder or on the verge. If you are able to continue driving to a parking lot, this is always preferable. However, in the event of a flat tyre, this is not possible.

sorular.soru: On which side can you overtake a tram?

feedback.metin: You can overtake a tram on both the left and right if space permits and it is safe. Keep the rails in mind in bad weather conditions, as these can be very slippery.

sorular.soru: There are no other drivers approaching. Should you stop here?

feedback.metin: The B-7 sign indicates that you are approaching an intersecting road where you must give right of way to all drivers on the intersecting road. The sign requires all drivers to stop even if there are no drivers approaching on the intersecting road.

sorular.soru: Should you present the APK certificate at a police check?

feedback.metin: During a police check, you only need to be able to show your valid driving licence and vehicle registration card. These must be original and undamaged. If you are not yet 18, you must also be able to show an attendant's pass for the attendant who is with you at that moment. The attendant must then also be able to show his or her driving licence. The APK is registered nationwide and fines for failure to inspect or late inspection are automatically issued via these systems. Therefore, you do not need to be able to show the inspection certificate. The police may perhaps check the condition of the vehicle during an inspection.

sorular.soru: Where can you find the maximum authorised roof load?
cevaplar: In the passenger car’s instruction booklet.
In the load carrier’s instruction booklet.
On the passenger car’s vehicle registration certificate.
sorular.dogruCevap: In the passenger car’s instruction booklet.

feedback.metin: The maximum authorised roof load is the maximum weight you can place on the roof of the passenger car. This comprises the total weight of the roof rails, roof rack, roof box, any other attachments, and the load. Usually this is around 75 kg. This maximum weight is noted in the vehicle’s instruction booklet.

sorular.soru: Which lights should you use when visibility is severely restricted by rain during the daytime?
cevaplar: Dipped headlights and possibly sidelights combined with front fog lights.
Dipped headlights, possibly combined with rear fog lights.
Dipped headlights, possibly combined with front or rear fog lights.
sorular.dogruCevap: Dipped headlights and possibly sidelights combined with front fog lights.

feedback.metin: When your visibility is seriously reduced due to rain, you should use dipped headlights. You may also use the front fog lights. In case of heavy fog, you can get blinded by your own dipped headlights. Therefore, you are allowed to use sidelights in combination with the front fog lights instead of the dipped headlights. Rear fog lights may only be used if visibility is less than 50 metres in fog or snowfall. Rear fog lights may not be used when it is raining, as they may blind drivers behind you.
